Generation II.Gold: Its sturdy wings look heavy, but they are actually hollow and light, allowing it to fly freely in the sky.
Generation II.Silver: After nesting in bramble bushes, the wings of its chicks grow hard from scratches by thorns.
Generation II.Crystal: The feathers that it sheds are very sharp. It is said that people once used the feathers as swords.
Generation II.Stadium 2: Its sturdy wings look heavy, but they are actually hollow and light, allowing it to fly freely in the sky. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) After nesting in bramble bushes, the wings of its chicks grow hard from scratches by thorns. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: Skarmory is entirely encased in hard, protective armor. This Pok é mon flies at close to 190 mph . It slashes foes with its wings that possess swordlike cutting edges.
Generation III.Sapphire: Skarmory 's steel wings become tattered and bashed in from repeated battles. Once a year, the battered wings grow back completely, restoring the cutting edges to their pristine state.
Generation III.Emerald: A Pok é mon that has a body and wings of steel. People in the past used feathers fallen from Skarmory to make swords and knives.
Generation III.FireRed: After nesting in bramble bushes, the wings of its chicks grow hard from scratches by thorns.
Generation III.LeafGreen: Its sturdy wings look heavy, but its bones are hollow and light, allowing it to fly freely in the sky.

Generation IV.Diamond: Despite being clad entirely in iron-hard armor, it flies at speeds over 180 mph .

Generation VI.X: After nesting in bramble bushes, the wings of its chicks grow hard from scratches by thorns.
Generation VI.Y: Despite being clad entirely in iron-hard armor, it flies at speeds over 180 mph .
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Skarmory is entirely encased in hard, protective armor. This Pokémon flies at close to 190 mph . It slashes foes with its wings that possess swordlike cutting edges.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Skarmory's steel wings become tattered and bashed in from repeated battles. Once a year, the battered wings grow back completely, restoring the cutting edges to their pristine state.

Generation VII.Sun: Its feathers, which fall off as it grows, are thin and sharp. In times long past, warriors used them as swords.
Generation VII.Moon: Its metal body is sturdy, but it does rust rather easily. So on rainy days, this Pokémon prefers to stay put in its nest.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: The wing feathers it sheds can be processed and made into knives whose sharpness is recognized by the finest chefs.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: Its body is draped in steel armor. It looks heavy, but it can fly at speeds of up to 185 miles an hour !

Generation VIII.Sword: The pointed feathers of these Pokémon are sharper than swords. Skarmory and Corviknight fight viciously over territory.
Generation VIII.Shield: People fashion swords from Skarmory's shed feathers, so this Pokémon is a popular element in heraldic designs.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: Skarmory is clad entirely in ironhard armor. It flies at speeds over 180 mph .
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: Skarmory is clad entirely in ironhard armor. It flies at speeds over 180 mph .

Generation IX.Scarlet: Its sturdy, heavy-looking iron body is actually thin and light, so it can fly at speeds over 180 mph.
Generation IX.Violet: Since the feathers that it sheds are thin and sharp, people apparently once used them as swords.
